intro: Geranium molle aureum, commonly known as the golden geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant golden-yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant features oval, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for hanging baskets and containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to produce clusters of small, showy flowers throughout the growing season.
